title: Incorrect error message when detach_
body_html:
Calling detach_ on some_view_variable.contiguous() variable gives weird error message. cc @colesbury

>>> x = Variable(torch.randn(3,1,2)).transpose(1, 0)
>>> x.detach_()
Traceback (most recent call last):
  File "<stdin>", line 1, in <module>
RuntimeError: Can't detach views in-place. Use detach() instead
>>> x.contiguous().detach_()
Traceback (most recent call last):
  File "<stdin>", line 1, in <module>
RuntimeError: Can't detach views in-place. Use detach() instead

body:
Calling `detach_` on `some_view_variable.contiguous()` variable gives weird error message. cc @colesbury 

```
>>> x = Variable(torch.randn(3,1,2)).transpose(1, 0)
>>> x.detach_()
Traceback (most recent call last):
  File "<stdin>", line 1, in <module>
RuntimeError: Can't detach views in-place. Use detach() instead
>>> x.contiguous().detach_()
Traceback (most recent call last):
  File "<stdin>", line 1, in <module>
RuntimeError: Can't detach views in-place. Use detach() instead
```
